intro: Tapeinidium philippinense, commonly known as the Philippine spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
